flavor: Bant's armies are primarily composed of members of the Mortar caste, loyal commoners who haven't yet earned a sigil.
name: Akrasan Squire
text: Exalted (Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, that creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
title: Akrasan Squire

flavor: Rigorous faith and belief are rewarded on occasion, and richly so.
name: Angel's Herald
text: {2}{W}, {T}, Sacrifice a green creature, a white creature, and a blue creature: Search your library for a card named Empyrial Archangel and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
title: Angel's Herald

flavor:
Even in single combat, I am never alone."
—Rafiq of the Many
name: Angelic Benediction
text:
Exalted (Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, that creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, you may tap target creature.
title: Angelic Benediction

flavor: Clash of sword and cry of beast fall mute when angels sound the call to prayer.
name: Angelsong
text:
Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
title: Angelsong

flavor: A night attack will be easy. We'll make an air raid over the Akrasan border. Just get me some flint to light the war torches.
name: Bant Battlemage
text:
{G}, {T}: Target creature gains trample until end of turn.
{U}, {T}: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.
title: Bant Battlemage

name: Battlegrace Angel
text:
Flying
Exalted (Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, that creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, it gains lifelink until end of turn.
title: Battlegrace Angel

flavor: Naya's trees grow tall and sturdy. Their foliage intertwines to form dewcups, rainwater pools where the elves gather to celebrate life.
name: Cradle of Vitality
text: Whenever you gain life, you may pay {1}{W}. If you do, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature for each 1 life you gained.
title: Cradle of Vitality

flavor:
I find its symmetry pleasing. It rids our world of offensive refuse while disposing of itself."
—Dolomarus, Proctor of the Clean
name: Dispeller's Capsule
text: {2}{W}, {T}, Sacrifice Dispeller's Capsule: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
title: Dispeller's Capsule

name: Elspeth, Knight-Errant
text:
+1: Put a 1/1 white Soldier creature token onto the battlefield.
+1: Target creature gets +3/+3 and gains flying until end of turn.
−8: You get an emblem with "Artifacts, creatures, enchantments, and lands you control have indestructible.
title: Elspeth, Knight-Errant

flavor: The noble work of our order is to infuse all life on Esper with etherium. Our goal will be reached more rapidly if new life is . . . suppressed.
name: Ethersworn Canonist
text: Each player who has cast a nonartifact spell this turn can't cast additional nonartifact spells.
title: Ethersworn Canonist

flavor: Rebels and other malcontents forced into the ritual awake lost in Topa's vast savannahs. Those who find their way back return humble and repentant.
name: Excommunicate
text: Put target creature on top of its owner's library.
title: Excommunicate

flavor:
Only by the bravery of those who put loyalty above glory is our home kept safe."
—Elspeth
name: Guardians of Akrasa
text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Exalted (Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, that creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
title: Guardians of Akrasa

flavor: The elves claim the canopy. The nacatl claim the mountains. I suppose you think we ought to stay on the jungle floor?
name: Gustrider Exuberant
text:
Flying
Sacrifice Gustrider Exuberant: Creatures you control with power 5 or greater gain flying until end of turn.
title: Gustrider Exuberant

flavor: Bantians believe those who are born into the highest caste and live a life of discipline and virtue can ascend to become angels.
name: Invincible Hymn
text: Count the number of cards in your library. Your life total becomes that number.
title: Invincible Hymn

flavor: The Order of the Skyward Eye does the bidding of an evil force, unwittingly stirring fear and mistrust across Bant in accordance with his plans.
name: Knight of the Skyward Eye
text: {3}{G}: Knight of the Skyward Eye gets +3/+3 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.
title: Knight of the Skyward Eye

flavor: Both guide and guard on open plain.
name: Knight of the White Orchid
text:
First strike
When Knight of the White Orchid enters the battlefield, if an opponent controls more lands than you, you may search your library for a Plains card, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle your library.
title: Knight of the White Orchid

flavor: The strength of Bant's caste system is the unfailing loyalty of its meekest members.
name: Knight-Captain of Eos
text:
When Knight-Captain of Eos enters the battlefield, put two 1/1 white Soldier creature tokens onto the battlefield.
{W}, Sacrifice a Soldier: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.
title: Knight-Captain of Eos

flavor: The cup was a gift from the sphinx Tameron, who hoped that those who drank from it would live long enough to decrypt the sphinxes' wisdom.
name: Marble Chalice
text: {T}: You gain 1 life.
title: Marble Chalice

flavor: By the time I got there, the heart had stopped. Fortunately, I was able to replace it with something better.
name: Metallurgeon
text: {W}, {T}: Regenerate target artifact.
title: Metallurgeon

flavor: A circle of light and a word of confinement.
name: Oblivion Ring
text:
When Oblivion Ring enters the battlefield, exile another target nonland permanent.
When Oblivion Ring leaves the battlefield, return the exiled card to the battlefield under its owner's control.
title: Oblivion Ring

flavor: At his side, humble beasts become weapons more deadly than sharpened steel.
name: Ranger of Eos
text: When Ranger of Eos enters the battlefield, you may search your library for up to two creature cards with converted mana cost 1 or less, reveal them, and put them into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.
title: Ranger of Eos

name: Resounding Silence
text:
Exile target attacking creature.
Cycling {5}{G}{W}{U} ({5}{G}{W}{U}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
When you cycle Resounding Silence, exile up to two target attacking creatures.
title: Resounding Silence

flavor:
Aven bandits can be sly. You've got to fill the sky with boulders—and then seek cover immediately."
—Knight-Captain Wyhorn
name: Rockcaster Platoon
text: {4}{G}: Rockcaster Platoon deals 2 damage to each creature with flying and each player.
title: Rockcaster Platoon

flavor: As their supplies of etherium dwindled, mechanists sent gargoyles farther and farther afield in search of salvage.
name: Sanctum Gargoyle
text:
Flying
When Sanctum Gargoyle enters the battlefield, you may return target artifact card from your graveyard to your hand.
title: Sanctum Gargoyle

flavor:
Soon I will sleep, eyes closing to a world tarnished with flesh, and then wake to a polished vision."
—Sharuum
name: Scourglass
text: {T}, Sacrifice Scourglass: Destroy all permanents except for artifacts and lands. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.
title: Scourglass

name: Sighted-Caste Sorcerer
text:
Exalted (Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, that creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
{U}: Sighted-Caste Sorcerer gains shroud until end of turn. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
title: Sighted-Caste Sorcerer

flavor: Each sigil marks the recognition of a great deed and signifies a duty owed to the one who granted it.
name: Sigiled Paladin
text:
First strike
Exalted (Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, that creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
title: Sigiled Paladin

flavor: An avatar he sculpts of fellowship and light.
name: Soul's Grace
text: You gain life equal to target creature's power.
title: Soul's Grace

flavor: Sunseeders quest for areas of open sky. They train plowbeasts to beat back the dense jungle long enough to cultivate a crop.
name: Sunseed Nurturer
text:
At the beginning of your end step, if you control a creature with power 5 or greater, you may gain 2 life.
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
title: Sunseed Nurturer

flavor:
Those talons really dig into your skin, but it's better than being dropped."
—Rafiq of the Many
name: Welkin Guide
text:
Flying
When Welkin Guide enters the battlefield, target creature gets +2/+2 and gains flying until end of turn.
title: Welkin Guide

flavor:
It is sacrilege to confine a gargantuan to the grinding of straight lines. I will pray that it remembers who is the master of this land."
—Syeena, elvish godtoucher
name: Yoked Plowbeast
text: Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
title: Yoked Plowbeast

flavor: On Bant, a sigil is both a prize of honor and a bond of duty. The one who bears it may be called to fulfill that charge at any moment.
name: Call to Heel
text: Return target creature to its owner's hand. Its controller draws a card.
title: Call to Heel

flavor: What you are attempting is not against the law. It is, however, extremely foolish.
name: Cancel
text: Counter target spell.
title: Cancel

flavor: Forget. Only then will there be space for hope between the pain and fear.
name: Cathartic Adept
text: {T}: Target player puts the top card of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
title: Cathartic Adept

flavor: A permanent storm rages over the plain of Cloudheath, and drakes ride its currents—two reminders that some elements of Esper will not be controlled.
name: Cloudheath Drake
text:
Flying
{1}{W}: Cloudheath Drake gains vigilance until end of turn.
title: Cloudheath Drake

flavor: Etherium does not know sleep. Only magic can teach it the resting state of cold steel.
name: Coma Veil
text:
Enchant artifact or creature
Enchanted permanent doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
title: Coma Veil

flavor: In ages past, Esper couriers bore messages written on ornate scrolls. The medium has grown more sophisticated, but the principle remains the same.
name: Courier's Capsule
text: {1}{U}, {T}, Sacrifice Courier's Capsule: Draw two cards.
title: Courier's Capsule

flavor: Before signing anything on Grixis, always read the fine print.
name: Covenant of Minds
text: Reveal the top three cards of your library. Target opponent may choose to put those cards into your hand. If he or she doesn't, put those cards into your graveyard and draw five cards.
title: Covenant of Minds

flavor: Their shots are fired most often as signals—or at those who didn't get the message.
name: Dawnray Archer
text:
Exalted (Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, that creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
{W}, {T}: Dawnray Archer deals 1 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.
title: Dawnray Archer

flavor: She can heal the flesh, or exploit its many weaknesses.
name: Esper Battlemage
text:
{W}, {T}: Prevent the next 2 damage that would be dealt to you this turn.
{B}, {T}: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
title: Esper Battlemage

flavor:
Speculation is foolish when the tools of certainty are available."
—Cinna, vedalken consul
name: Etherium Astrolabe
text:
Flash
{B}, {T}, Sacrifice an artifact: Draw a card.
title: Etherium Astrolabe

flavor: The greatest masters of the craft abandon tools altogether, shaping metal with hand and mind alone.
name: Etherium Sculptor
text: Artifact spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
title: Etherium Sculptor

name: Fatestitcher
text:
{T}: You may tap or untap another target permanent.

title: Fatestitcher

flavor: We of the Sanctum Arcanum have pondered every word on every page of the Filigree Texts. If you can't say the same, don't bother speaking.
name: Filigree Sages
text: {2}{U}: Untap target artifact.
title: Filigree Sages

flavor:
It's free to do whatever it wants. I've merely told it what that is."
—Xorin, Architect of Will
name: Gather Specimens
text: If a creature would enter the battlefield under an opponent's control this turn, it enters the battlefield under your control instead.
title: Gather Specimens

flavor: She stands ready, always watchful, knowing that weeks of peace and serenity can be overturned by a single distant sail.
name: Jhessian Lookout
title: Jhessian Lookout

name: Kathari Screecher
text:
Flying
Unearth {2}{U} ({2}{U}: Return this card from your graveyard to the battlefield. It gains haste. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step or if it would leave the battlefield. Unearth only as a sorcery.)

flavor: Only a mind unfettered with the concerns of the flesh can see the world as it truly is.
name: Master of Etherium
text:
Master of Etherium's power and toughness are each equal to the number of artifacts you control.
Other artifact creatures you control get +1/+1.
title: Master of Etherium

flavor:
The Filigree Texts do not compel you to act in accordance with their precepts. They only specify the consequences should you fail."
—Lodus of the Ethersworn
name: Memory Erosion
text: Whenever an opponent casts a spell, that player puts the top two cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
title: Memory Erosion

flavor: Rogue mechanists once rummaged through the wastes of the Tidehollow, constructing unauthorized golems to threaten the hegemony of the sphinxes. The orbs put a stop to that.
name: Mindlock Orb
text: Players can't search libraries.
title: Mindlock Orb

flavor: The island nation of Jhess is under constant siege from Valeron on the mainland. Riders traverse the coastline, always on the lookout for sails or aven.
name: Outrider of Jhess
text: Exalted (Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, that creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
title: Outrider of Jhess

flavor:
There is no such thing as scrap metal. All such material can be repaired with the proper bonding agent."
—Quennus, metallurgeon
name: Protomatter Powder
text: {4}{W}, {T}, Sacrifice Protomatter Powder: Return target artifact card from your graveyard to the battlefield.

Return target permanent to its owner's hand.

title: Resounding Wave

flavor: Whether mechanical or biological, life finds a way to propagate itself.
name: Sharding Sphinx
text:
Flying
Whenever an artifact creature you control deals combat damage to a player, you may put a 1/1 blue Thopter artifact creature token with flying onto the battlefield.
title: Sharding Sphinx

name: Skill Borrower
text:
Play with the top card of your library revealed.
As long as the top card of your library is an artifact or creature card, Skill Borrower has all activated abilities of that card. (If any of the abilities use that card's name, use this creature's name instead.)

flavor:
Magic cast through a hand of flesh is just as weak as the flesh itself."
—Lodus of the Ethersworn
name: Spell Snip
text:
Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1}.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

flavor: He calls a riddle through the gaps of cloven clouds, hoping for an answer.
name: Sphinx's Herald
text: {2}{U}, {T}, Sacrifice a white creature, a blue creature, and a black creature: Search your library for a card named Sphinx Sovereign and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
title: Sphinx's Herald

flavor:
From the highest towers to the deepest sea, all life must be touched by etherium."
—Lodus of the Ethersworn
name: Steelclad Serpent
text: Steelclad Serpent can't attack unless you control another artifact.
title: Steelclad Serpent

name: Tezzeret the Seeker
text:
+1: Untap up to two target artifacts.
−X: Search your library for an artifact card with converted mana cost X or less and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
−5: Artifacts you control become artifact creatures with base power and toughness 5/5 until end of turn.
title: Tezzeret the Seeker

flavor: At sea, the Jhessian fleet strikes swiftly and decisively. On land, facing the elite cavalry of Valeron, its marines must rely on more cautious strategies.
name: Tortoise Formation
text: Creatures you control gain shroud until end of turn. (They can't be the targets of spells or abilities.)
title: Tortoise Formation

flavor: Even on Esper, there are those who eschew the use of magic in favor of simpler methods.
name: Vectis Silencers
text: {2}{B}: Vectis Silencers gains deathtouch until end of turn. (Any amount of damage it deals to a creature is enough to destroy that creature.)
title: Vectis Silencers

flavor: When the task spilled over into undeath, he stopped calling it his life's work.
name: Ad Nauseam
text: Reveal the top card of your library and put that card into your hand. You lose life equal to its converted mana cost. You may repeat this process any number of times.
title: Ad Nauseam

flavor: The necropolis at Unx was once a living city, its streets untrodden by death.
name: Archdemon of Unx
text:
Flying, trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice a non-Zombie creature, then put a 2/2 black Zombie creature token onto the battlefield.
title: Archdemon of Unx

flavor: The consuming undeath of Grixis terrifies the survivors of Vithia, but its fauna is just as fearsome.
name: Banewasp Affliction
text:
Enchant creature
When enchanted creature dies, that creature's controller loses life equal to its toughness.
title: Banewasp Affliction

flavor: Warriors of the Rip Clan wear their beetle-acid scars proudly, even modifying clothing and armor to better display the trophy.
name: Blister Beetle
text: When Blister Beetle enters the battlefield, target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
title: Blister Beetle

flavor: Witches of the Split-Eye Coven speak of a future when Grixis will overflow with life energy. For now, they must harvest vis from the living to fuel their dark magics.
name: Bone Splinters
text:
As an additional cost to cast Bone Splinters, sacrifice a creature.
Destroy target creature.
title: Bone Splinters

name: Corpse Connoisseur
text:
When Corpse Connoisseur enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a creature card and put that card into your graveyard. If you do, shuffle your library.
Unearth {3}{B} ({3}{B}: Return this card from your graveyard to the battlefield. It gains haste. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step or if it would leave the battlefield. Unearth only as a sorcery.)
title: Corpse Connoisseur

flavor: Give me your memories, and you will have release from the suffering they bring you.
name: Cunning Lethemancer
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, each player discards a card.
title: Cunning Lethemancer

flavor: For the necromancer barons, killing and recruitment are one and the same.
name: Death Baron
text: Skeleton creatures you control and other Zombie creatures you control get +1/+1 and have deathtouch.
title: Death Baron

flavor: The bones of allies grant wisdom. The bones of enemies grant strength. The bones of dragons grant life eternal.
name: Deathgreeter
text: Whenever another creature dies, you may gain 1 life.
title: Deathgreeter

flavor: May these deaths be the first of many.
name: Demon's Herald
text: {2}{B}, {T}, Sacrifice a blue creature, a black creature, and a red creature: Search your library for a card named Prince of Thralls and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
title: Demon's Herald

flavor:
On our thirty-fourth day of digging, we unearthed a chamber that contained the intact remains of several species long extinct from Grixis. One in particular should make a fine siege engine . . . ."
—Last notes of Shungus Nod, fleshcrafter
name: Dreg Reaver
title: Dreg Reaver

flavor: The undead of Grixis are fueled by their hatred of the living.
name: Dregscape Zombie
text: Unearth {B} ({B}: Return this card from your graveyard to the battlefield. It gains haste. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step or if it would leave the battlefield. Unearth only as a sorcery.)
title: Dregscape Zombie

flavor: There is always a moment of trepidation before opening a message capsule, for fear of the judgment that might be contained within.
name: Executioner's Capsule
text: {1}{B}, {T}, Sacrifice Executioner's Capsule: Destroy target nonblack creature.
title: Executioner's Capsule

flavor: Grixis is a world where the only things found in abundance are death and decay. Corpses, whole or in part, are the standard currency among necromancers and demons.
name: Fleshbag Marauder
text: When Fleshbag Marauder enters the battlefield, each player sacrifices a creature.
title: Fleshbag Marauder

flavor: Before the zealots of the Ethersworn came to power, Esper illusionists dreamed up creations to mimic a variety of substances.
name: Glaze Fiend
text:
Flying
Whenever another artifact enters the battlefield under your control, Glaze Fiend gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

flavor: Vitals of Grixis who eschew undeath must scrape and scratch to retain their mortality. The result is a breed of inventive mages.
name: Grixis Battlemage
text:
{U}, {T}: Draw a card, then discard a card.
{R}, {T}: Target creature can't block this turn.

text:
{T}, Exile two cards from your graveyard: Draw a card.
If damage would be dealt to you, prevent that damage. Exile a card from your graveyard for each 1 damage prevented this way.
When there are no cards in your graveyard, you lose the game.
title: Immortal Coil

flavor:
This is why we don't go out in banewasp weather."
—Rannon, Vithian holdout
name: Infest
text: All creatures get -2/-2 until end of turn.
title: Infest

flavor: The goblet was a gift from the sphinx Gorael, who hoped humans and vedalken would eventually destroy each other to acquire it, leaving all of Esper to her own kind.
name: Onyx Goblet
text: {T}: Target player loses 1 life.

flavor: He scowls at his imperfect creation, then crushes it to scrap. He salvages the etherium and begins anew.
name: Puppet Conjurer
text:
{U}, {T}: Put a 0/1 blue Homunculus artifact creature token onto the battlefield.
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice a Homunculus.

text:

name: Scavenger Drake
text:
Flying
Whenever another creature dies, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Scavenger Drake.

flavor:
The future is a snake, devouring your life backwards through time. And when you die, believe me, it doesn't stop feeding."
—Sedris, the Traitor King
name: Shadowfeed
text: Exile target card from a graveyard. You gain 3 life.

Flying
{B}, Sacrifice a creature: Regenerate Skeletal Kathari.

The dragon is a perfect marriage of power and the will to use it."
—Sarkhan Vol
name: Crucible of Fire

flavor: Goblins journey to the sacrificial peaks in pairs so that the rare survivor might be able to relate the details of the other's grisly demise.

flavor: The penultimate step of the ritual involves bathing in a delicious glaze.

text:
Flying

text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a 1/1 red Goblin creature token with haste onto the battlefield.
Goblin creatures attack each turn if able.
